Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk 389-ds-base
exit 0

exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi

if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: 389-ds-base bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The 389 Directory Server is an LDAPv3 compliant server. The base packages include the LDAP server and command-line utilities for server administration. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the code of search requests for asynchronous simple paged results was not thread-safe, which created a small window during which a conflict could occur in the simple paged result slot. As a consequence, the server could terminate unexpectedly. To fix this bug, the code is now thread-safe, and the crash no longer occurs in this situation. In addition, abandoning simple paged results request was previously not handled correctly if an abandon request was issued too quickly. Consequently, an internal search result object was in some cases not released. With this update, the search result request is safely released regardless of the timing of the abandon request. (BZ#1230037) Prior to this update, a helper function to check whether the cache size is valid or not was resetting the cash size to a very small value. Consequently, the helper function was applied and the Distinguished Name (DN) cache was applied at the server start-up timing, which reduced the cache size. With this update, the helper function provides only the validity check and no longer resets the cache size. As a result, the entry and DN cache sizes do not get affected by the helper function. (BZ#1230038) Previously, when AD users had multiple spaces inside the value of the RDN attribute, synchronizing the entry to the Directory Server failed. The underlying source code has been fixed, and Windows Synchronization (WinSync) plug-in in the Directory Server now works as expected. (BZ#1243718) Users of 389-ds-base are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. After installing this update, the 389 server service will be restarted automatically. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
